test.assertion: When a GetCapabilities request contains a parameter which is not defined by the spec, the result is valid.
When a GetMap request contains a parameter which is not defined by the spec, the result is valid.
When a GetFeatureInfo request contains a parameter which is not defined by the spec, the result is valid.
When a GetCapabilities request is made for a supported version, then the response is the requested version.
When a GetCapabilities request is made for version 0.0.0, the response is between 0.0.0 and [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]], inclusive.
No dimension name values in the capabilities document contain whitespace.
All declarations for the time dimension use 'ISO8601' for units.
All declarations for the elevation dimension use an EPSG vertical datum for units.
The server implements the CITE standard dataset in subsettable, resizable layers that support EPSG:4326.
The server supports GetMap format image/gif and/or image/png.
The server implements the CITE standard dataset in subsettable, resizable layers that support EPSG:4326.
The server supports GetMap format image/gif and/or image/png.
The server supports GetFeatureInfo requests and the CITE standard dataset layers containing polygons are queryable.
The application/vnd.ogc.se_xml exception format is listed in the capabilities document.
When REQUEST is "capabilities", then the response is capabilities XML.
When a GetCapabilities request is made with an UPDATESEQUENCE parameter, then the UPDATESEQUENCE parameter is ignored.
When a GetCapabilities request is made with an UPDATESEQUENCE parameter set to the current update sequence value, then the server returns a valid exception (code=CurrentUpdateSequence).
When a GetCapabilities request is made with an UPDATESEQUENCE parameter set to a value lower than the current update sequence value, then the server returns capabilities XML.
When a GetCapabilities request is made with an UPDATESEQUENCE parameter set to a value higher than the current update sequence value, then the server returns an InvalidUpdateSequence exception.
When a GetCapabilities request is made with an UPDATESEQUENCE parameter set to a value lower than the current update sequence value, then the server returns capabilities XML.
When a GetCapabilities request is made with an UPDATESEQUENCE parameter set to a value higher than the current update sequence value, then the server returns an InvalidUpdateSequence exception.
When a GetCapabilities request is made for the version in test using WMTVER instead of VERSION, then the response is the requested version.
When a GetCapabilities request is made for a supported version other than [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]] using WMTVER instead of VERSION, then the version returned is the version requested.
When a GetCapabilities request is made with VERSION set to [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]] and WMTVER set to 0.0.0 and VERSION precedes WMTVER, then the version returned is [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]].
When a GetCapabilities request is made with VERSION set to [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]] and WMTVER set to 100.0.0 and VERSION precedes WMTVER, then the version returned is [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]].
When a GetCapabilities request is made with VERSION set to [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]] and WMTVER set to 0.0.0 and WMTVER precedes VERSION, then the version returned is [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]].
When a GetCapabilities request is made with VERSION set to [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]] and WMTVER set to 100.0.0 and WMTVER precedes VERSION, then the version returned is [[VAR_WMS_VERSION]].
When a GetCapabilities request is made, then the content-type header of the response is application/vnd.ogc.wms_xml
The response to a GetCapabilities request references a valid copy of the DTD in Annex A.1 at a fully-qualified and accessible location and validates with the DTD.
Each OnlineResource URL intended for HTTP Get requests in the capabilities document is a URL prefix
The output format application/vnd.ogc.gml is listed for the GetFeatureInfo operation.
The Service Name element in the capabilities document has the value "OGC:WMS".
The word "none" (case-insensitive) is used in the content of the Fees element and the AccessConstraints element of the capabilities document.
For each of the layer elements in the capabilities document, each BoundingBox on the layer states a different SRS.
There are no child Dimension elements in the capabilities document that use a name attribute that is defined in a parent layer.
Each Extent element in the capabilities document uses a name that has been declared or inherited in a corresponding Dimension element.
There are no child Layer elements in the capabilities document that define an AuthorityURL with the same name attribute as one inherited from a parent layer.
There are no Layer elements in the capabilities document that declare an Identifier without also declaring or inheriting a corresponding AuthorityURL.
The root layer in the capabilities document has a LatLonBoundingBox.
The minx, miny, maxx, and maxy attributes on each LatLonBoundingBox are expressed in decimal degrees.
The root layer in the capabilities document has at least one SRS element.
There are no child layers in the capabilities document that redefine a Style with the same name as one inherited from one of its parents.
When an exception is raised and the EXCEPTIONS parameter is absent from the request, then the Content-type header of the response is application/vnd.ogc.se_xml.
When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=application/vnd.ogc.se_xml, then the Content-type header of the response is application/vnd.ogc.se_xml.
When the FEATURE_COUNT parameter is not specified, then less data is returned than when FEATURE_COUNT is 2.
When the FEATURE_COUNT parameter is 1, then less data is returned than when FEATURE_COUNT is 2.
When the INFO_FORMAT parameter is missing, then the Content-type header returned is one of the formats advertised.
When the INFO_FORMAT parameter is application/vnd.ogc.gml, then the Content-type header returned is the same.
When the INFO_FORMAT parameter is application/vnd.ogc.gml, then the response validates with the Galdos GML instance document validator.
When a GetFeatureInfo request contains a single layer, then the response is valid.
When a GetFeatureInfo request contains two layers, then the response is valid.
When a GetFeatureInfo request contains three layers, then the response is valid.
When a GetFeatureInfo request contains fewer layers in the QUERY_LAYERS parameter than it does in the LAYERS parameter, then the response is valid.
When a layer requested is not contained in the Capabilities XML of the WMS, then the server issues a Service Exception.
When GetFeatureInfo is requested on a Layer that is not queryable, then the server issues a Service Exception (code="LayerNotQueryable").
When a GetMap request uses integer values for the BBOX parameter, then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request uses decimal values for the BBOX parameter, then the response is valid.
When a request contains a Bounding Box with y values that are beyond 90 degrees, then the server returns empty content for the area beyond 90 degrees.
When a request contains a Bounding Box with x values that are beyond 180 degrees, then the server returns empty content for the area beyond 180 degrees.
When a request contains a Bounding Box with x values that are beyond 180 degrees, then the server returns content that spans the anti-meridian.
When a GetMap request uses scientific notation values for the BBOX parameter, then the response is valid.
The server interprets the bounding box as going around the "outside" of the pixels of the image rather than through the centers of the border pixels.
When the BBOX parameter's minimum X is greater than the maximum X, then the server throws an exception.
When the BBOX parameter's minimum X is equal to the maximum X, then the server throws an exception.
When the BBOX parameter's minimum Y is greater than the maximum Y, then the server throws an exception.
When the BBOX parameter's minimum Y is equal to the maximum Y, then the server throws an exception.
When a request contains a Bounding Box whose area does not overlap at all with the BoundingBox advertised, then the server returns empty content.
When a GetMap request is made with no BGCOLOR parameter, then areas which are not covered contain white (0xFFFFFF) pixels.
When a GetMap request is made with a BGCOLOR parameter, then areas which are not covered are set to the value of BGCOLOR.
When an exception is raised without specifying the EXCEPTIONS parameter, then the Content-type of the return header is application/vnd.ogc.se_xml.
When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=application/vnd.ogc.se_xml, then the Content-type of the return header is application/vnd.ogc.se_xml.
When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=application/vnd.ogc.se_inimage, then the error messages are graphically returned as part of the content.
When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=application/vnd.ogc.se_inimage, then the Content-type of the return header is the same as the FORMAT requested.
When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=application/vnd.ogc.se_blank, TRANSPRENT=FALSE, and BGCOLOR=0xFF0000, then the image returned contains only red pixels.
When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=application/vnd.ogc.se_blank and TRANSPRENT=TRUE, then the image returned contains only transparent pixels.
When an exception is raised and EXCEPTIONS=application/vnd.ogc.se_blank, then the Content-type of the return header is the same as the FORMAT requested.
When a GetMap request contains a Format that is not advertised, then the server throws a Service Exception (code="InvalidFormat").
When a GetMap request is made using format=image/gif, then the response is a valid gif.
When a GetMap request is made using format=image/jpeg, then the response is a valid jpeg.
When a GetMap request is made using format=image/png, then the response is a valid png.
When a GetMap request contains a single layer name, then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains two layer names (separated by a comma), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains three layer names (separated by commas), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains multiple layers, then the response renders the requested layers by drawing the leftmost in the list bottommost, and the next one over that.
When the layer in a GetMap request is invalid, then the response is an exception (code="LayerNotDefined").
When a GetMap request contains two layers where the first is valid and the second is invalid, then the response is an exception (code="LayerNotDefined").
When a GetMap request contains two layers where the first is invalid and the second is valid, then the response is an exception (code="LayerNotDefined").
When a GetMap request is made using REQUEST=map instead of REQUEST=GetMap, the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a SRS where the SRS is contained directly in the layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a SRS where the SRS is inherited by the layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.
When the SRS parameter in a GetMap request contains a SRS that is not valid for any of the layers being requested, then the server shall throw a Service Exception (code = "InvalidSRS").
When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a single style where the style is contained directly in the layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains two layers, where one of the styles is valid and one is not, then the response is an exception (code=StyleNotDefined).
When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a single style where the style is inherited by the layer in the capabilities document, then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains two layers and two styles (separated by a comma), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains three layers and three styles (separated by commas), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains an unadvertised Style, then the response is an exception (code=StyleNotDefined).
When a GetMap request contains a single layer and a null style value (as in "STYLES="), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains multiple layers and a mixture of named and default styles (as in "STYLES=style1,,style2,,"), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains multiple layers and requests all layers to be shown in the default style by using null values between commas (as in "STYLES=,,,"), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request contains multiple layers and requests all layers to be shown in the default style by using a single null value (as in "STYLES="), then the response is valid.
When a GetMap request is made with no TRANSPARENT parameter and a FORMAT that supports transparency over a BBOX that is not completely covered, then the response contains no transparent pixels.
When a GetMap request is made with TRANSPARENT=fAlSe and a FORMAT that supports transparency over a BBOX that is not completely covered, then the response contains no transparent pixels.
When a GetMap request is made with TRANSPARENT=TRUE and a FORMAT that supports transparency over a BBOX that is not completely covered, then the response contains transparent pixels.
When a GetMap request is made using WMTVER instead of VERSION, the response is valid.
When a request is made with WIDTH=1024 and HEIGHT=768, the image returned is exactly the size requested.
When a request is made with WIDTH=16 and HEIGHT=16, the image returned is exactly the size requested.
When a GetMap request is made where the aspect ratio of the BBOX and the aspect ratio of the WIDTH/HEIGHT parameters is different, then the map returned is stretched.
For each advertised GetFeatureInfo format, when a GetFeatureInfo request is made with the INFO_FORMAT parameter set to the format, then the Content-type header returned is the same.
For each of the Styles in the capabilities document, when a GetMap request is made with the STYLES parameter set to the element of the style, then the response is valid.
For each of the Layers in the capabilities document, when a GetMap request is made with the LAYERS parameter set to the element of the layer, then the response is valid.
For each SRS in the capabilities document, when a GetMap request uses the SRS, then the response is valid.
For each image format advertised in capabilities, When a GetMap request is made using the image format, then the Content-type entity header returned is the format requested.
For each format a request with TRANSPARENT=TRUE does not return an exception.
When a layer is requested using encoded characters in its name, the response is a map.
When an exception is generated, it validates.
This WMS is valid
This WMS is valid against 'no' profile
This WMS is valid against the 'basic' profile
This WMS is valid against the 'queryable' profile
This WMS is valid against the test 'Recommendation Support'
This WMS is valid against the test 'GML FeatureInfo'
This WMS is valid against the test 'Fees and Access Constraints'
This WMS is valid against the test 'BoundingBox Constraints'

suite.title: Web Map Service (WMS) 1.1.1 Test Suite
suite.description: Validates that a WMS 1.1.1 is compliant with the spec.

body.p: The Web Map Service test scripts are designed to test WMS implementations based on the WMS 1.1.1 specification.
Detailed information about the test suite is available here.
The number of tests actually executed will depend on the capabilities advertised in the capabilities URL supplied below as well as the other options selected below.
Many of the tests require implementation of the standard dataset. Implementation of the dataset is required for certification.
Enter a capabilities document URL below. This may be the URL to a static capabilities document, or a GetCapabilities request from a WMS. A typical GetCapabilities request will take this form:

The WMS spec allows servers to use an UpdateSequence value for maintaining cache consistency as described here. If the server advertises an UpdateSequence value and the Automatic option is selected below, the test suite will attempt to test the UpdateSequence behavior automatically. However, the lexical ordering of UpdateSequence values is determined by the server, so the tests may not always be correct. If you suspect a problem, select the Manual option and enter the updateSequence values requested below.

tr.td: Automatic - The updateSequence tests will use automatically generated updateSequence values
Manual - The updateSequence tests will use the values supplied below

body.p: (Fill in these boxes only if the Manual option is selected above)

tr.td: A value that is lexically higher than the current updateSequence value
A value that is lexically lower than the current updateSequence value

body.p: Certification is available for servers that implement either the BASIC profile or the QUERYABLE profile. In order to be certified, the server must implement the requirements for the profile as described here. Select which profile you want to test below.

tr.td: NONE - Do not certify that the server meets requirements for any test profile
BASIC - Certify that the server meets all requirements for the BASIC profile
QUERYABLE - Certify that the server meets all requirements for the QUERYABLE profile

body.p: The remaining tests are not required for certification, but may prove informative or be useful as a debugging aid.

tr.td: Verify that the server supports fuctionality which is recommended in the spec, but not required

Verify that the server supports the application/vnd.ogc.gml GetFeatureInfo format. This test will pass only if the GML instance document returned contains a schemaLocation attribute to reference its schema, and validates correctly.
Verify that the server advertises that it does not require any fees or access constraints
LOOSE - Verify that the server returns map data from the western hemisphere for area beyond 180 degrees east longitude
STRICT - Verify that the server does not return map data from the western hemisphere for area beyond 180 degrees east longitude
EITHER - Do not test area beyond 180 degrees east longitude
